intro: Dischistocalyx, commonly known as the African wild bean, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in local cuisines. Dischistocalyx species are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. These plants play an important role in both ecological systems and traditional agriculture in their native habitats.
